text:
Is there a name for optimization but you don't have an objective but you have an Oracle which you query to compare solutions and get the best of the bunch?
The Oracle doesn't have to impose a total and strict ordering but it is transitive.
The variables making up the objects can be real valued, integer valued or categorical.
Constraints might be (partially) know without querying an oracle.

Or something like that.

elements.text:
Is there a name for optimization but you don't have an objective but you have an Oracle which you query to compare solutions and get the best of the bunch?
The Oracle doesn't have to impose a total and strict ordering but it is transitive.
The variables making up the objects can be real valued, integer valued or categorical.
Constraints might be (partially) know without querying an oracle.

Or something like that.

text: So you give a number of candidates to the oracle, eg, x1, x2, ... (here each x is a vector), and it returns which is the “best” (eg x3) among all the trial points?
